sustainability.title: Sustainable Practice Tip
sustainability.setup_message: Complete your roadmap setup to get personalized sustainability tips!

tips.irrigation: 💧 Use drip irrigation to save 30% water. Consider rainwater harvesting for sustainable water management.
tips.pest: 🐛 Implement integrated pest management with beneficial insects. Use neem oil as natural pesticide.
tips.fertilizer: 🌱 Use compost and organic fertilizers. Create your own compost from kitchen waste and farm residues.
tips.default: 🌍 Practice crop rotation and intercropping for soil health. Use cover crops to prevent soil erosion.

questions.weather: What's the weather forecast for my crops?
questions.irrigation: How often should I water my crops?
questions.fertilizer: What fertilizer should I use for my crops?
questions.pest_control: How can I control pests naturally?
questions.harvest: When is the best time to harvest?
questions.soil_health: How can I improve my soil health?
questions.crop_rotation: What is crop rotation and why is it important?
questions.government_schemes: What government schemes are available for farmers?
questions.market_prices: How can I check current market prices?
questions.disease_detection: How can I detect plant diseases early?

answers.weather: 🌤️ Check the weather forecast in the app's weather section. For crops, monitor temperature, rainfall, and humidity. Rainy weather is good for irrigation, while sunny weather helps with growth and ripening.
answers.irrigation: 💧 Water frequency depends on crop type, soil, and weather. Generally, water when top 2-3 inches of soil is dry. Use drip irrigation for efficiency and water conservation.
answers.fertilizer: 🌱 Use organic fertilizers like compost and manure. For chemical fertilizers, follow soil test recommendations. Apply fertilizers during active growth periods for best results.
answers.pest_control: 🐛 Use natural methods: neem oil, beneficial insects, crop rotation, and proper spacing. Avoid chemical pesticides when possible. Monitor crops regularly for early pest detection.
answers.harvest: 🌾 Harvest timing varies by crop. Look for maturity signs: color change, size, and texture. Harvest in early morning for better quality. Check market prices before harvesting.
answers.soil_health: 🌍 Improve soil with organic matter, crop rotation, cover crops, and proper pH balance. Test soil regularly and add nutrients as needed. Avoid over-tilling.
answers.crop_rotation: 🔄 Crop rotation prevents soil depletion and pest buildup. Rotate between different plant families. Plan 3-4 year rotation cycles for best results.
answers.government_schemes: 🏛️ Check the Policy Dashboard for available schemes like PM-KISAN, crop insurance, irrigation subsidies, and seed distribution programs. Apply online through government portals.
answers.market_prices: 📈 Use the Market Updates section to check current prices. Prices vary by location and season. Plan your harvest timing based on market trends and demand.
answers.disease_detection: 🔍 Use the Disease Detection feature to scan plant images. Look for spots, discoloration, wilting, or unusual growth. Early detection helps prevent spread.

organic.neem_pesticides: 🌱 Neem-based pesticides trending for pest control
organic.compost_tea: 🥬 Compost tea gaining popularity for soil health
